website_summaries.verdict: A good buy if you're looking for a balance between quiet running and performance.
pros: Exceptionally quiet with the same grinding ability of noisier models
cons: Water is slow to drain while in use

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISEMENT
customer_reviews.text: This product is advertised as "stainless steel" components with a stainless steel stopper. My plumber just opened mine to find that the stopper is cheap plastic. It makes us both wonder if the product is authentic with stainless steel components. Will be requesting a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Juli

customer_reviews.title: The unit did not work out of box. Was ...
customer_reviews.text: The unit did not work out of box. Was it tested? I called the factory and after a 25 minute phone call / wait on hold, I was told the unit must be installed before their warranty would cover replacement. So I had to pay a plumber not only to wait while I talked to a representative but I also had to pay him to replace a unit that did run with one that did not. I asked for a supervisor to override this requirement but all he would say was that is their policy.
customer_reviews.author: Arjay7

customer_reviews.title: but I was super careful. It was a luxury as we also ...
customer_reviews.text: This was installed in January 2014. I had lived with out one for 8 years. We are a household of TWO. I am a really light user as I had a horrid experience in my first apartment of my neighbor's St Paddy's day boiled dinner peels arriving in my kitchen. I don't put down peels. I scoop and pitch. It got run maybe twice a week. 3 years later ...dead. I know that they aren't the longest lasting appliances .. but I was super careful. It was a luxury as we also have a septic.
customer_reviews.author: P. Brannigan

customer_reviews.title: A "Worth It" Upgrade from the Badger Model
customer_reviews.text: I have included pictures of the new disposal and our old disposal for a comparison of how how they fit in our same, limited space. We purchased this unit to replace a failing half horsepower "Badger" model, and we are thrilled! The slight upgrade in cost was definitely worth it, and we believe we have reduced our risk of plugged drains from things like potato peels. This disposal attached easily to our existing garbage disposal mount, and fit our plumbing without any interference. It is quieter and I believe it grinds the food better than the basic model. I cannot imagine the additional costs of other, more expensive models are worth it, but this one was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Easy to replace a like disposal with a replacement. No plumber required. Unplug electric , unhook 2 drains (if connected to dishwasher). Take old unit down. Use existing electrical plug on new machine. Hang back up. Connect drains, test for leaks. Plug in to electrical outlet and test new disposal. Took 1 and 1/2 hours from taking new machine out of box, installing new and throwing old out in dumpster. Plumber quote installed was $800. $200 unit cost and my retiree time. Good instructions included. Select a disposal that most closely or exactly matches the drain configuration, particularly to the sink drain. Go on a shopping spree with your $ savings.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Good product, instructions are horrible and missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Is it me or do the instructions show it includes a sink baffle (it is included) but never mention its installation anywhere in the instructions? Does it go on top of the preinstalled rubber gasket, do you remove the preinstalled gasket, is there an option? Took an extra 20 mins trying to figure this out and spent 15 mins on hold with the answer line. Waste of time. Finally got through and they say it pushes down in from the top. Problem: the top edge of the baffle is exposed to sharp objects and food to get stuck. Absolutely horrible design.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy self install if you are replacing an Insinkerator
customer_reviews.text: Had an older insinkerator disposal that was still working but made a loud grinding noise and was past warranty. Rather than pay a plumber to come and check it out I bought this model on Amazon and did the install myself. The install is relatively easy for an experienced do it your selfer. The most difficult part in my experience was the plumbing connections because of the way my drain pipe was oriented. Mounting is simple enough once you figure it out and the 8 year in home warranty is nice. Don't forget to buy the power plug connection kit if you are plugging this into an electric outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Tyfighter

customer_reviews.title: Durable, just be patient when overheats!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit November 2011 and I thought I burned the unit because it over heated and won’t reset. So, I placed an order right away and the order went through. After maybe a couple of hours I checked the unit under the sink and it has cooled down but still warm. I pushed the reset button and it reset so I turned it on and it worked, now I have to cancel the order but It was too late. When the unit came I returned it to Kohl’s where they pick up returns. I got my refund the 3rd day. Bottom line this product may last for more than 10 years I guess. Five stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Charity

customer_reviews.title: So far, So good
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this to replace a 444 that was 14 years old and just failed. This unit fit perfectly and was easy to install. It is very QUIET compared to the 444 which shook the entire house! (As far as the 1 star reviewer that said it "broke and ruined my cabinets", it is obvious from the photos that the unit was not locked in properly to the under sink base unit and came unscrewed, there by not functioning. If it was a do-it-yourself, they screwed up. If a plumber did it-call & fire him!)
customer_reviews.author: backdoc

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It has not even been a month and it is making a lot of noise. I purchase the installation through Amazon and I was less than impressed by the plumber that came out to install it. He did not seem like he knew what he was doing and he was also very frustrated with the fact that it did not fit correctly. So I had to pay an extra $100 on top of what I had already paid for the installation service so that he can cut the tools to make them fit. Over all this experience has been very frustrating. I would give this review less than one star if I could.
customer_reviews.author: C M

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a few Badger garbage disposals in my last three houses and they're nothing compared to this model. It's so quiet you can barely hear it (I have a 16 gauge stainless sink). I would never think of grinding up chicken bones but after reading reviews did so last night right after I installed it. Five chicken bones were ground up in about 6 seconds. I wasn't going to replace my garbage disposal when I replaced my sink but am 100% glad I did. Buy this and don't look back.
customer_reviews.author: JASMan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent garbage disposal
customer_reviews.text: As with most disposals, this one is made by InSinkErator. There's a couple of important improvements to this model. 1 - It's very quiet, in particular in this price range. 2. It grinds up things really fast 3. The rubber gasket is easily removable!! This prevents that icky slime to build up on the inside of the gasket within a matter of days. This is such a vast improvement over my last disposal. 4. Because the gasket is removable, it's easy to see down into the blade area for anything that needs to be removed, like a peach pit. AND you can see by observing that the blades aren't moving.
customer_reviews.author: DailyReader

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, quiet but make sure you really pay attention to the instructions
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for my failing badger insinkerator. The packaging was good, kept the product safe. The instructions were thorough, although a bit difficult to follow, which lead me to missing and important step. This is probably more on me and how I was viewing them, but still worth calling out. Installation was a breeze. The hardest part of it was honestly adjusting the length of the pipe and that was just due to it being wider than the previous model. Not a detriment to this device at all. Noise level is whisper quiet compared to my previous one. You can definitely hear it when there’s water and debris being ground, but it’s whisper quiet once it clears. Very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Jomo

customer_reviews.title: Stopped grinding immediately after warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: l couldn't understand why nothing was getting ground up. It was running and sounded like it was working. Took out the rubber drain and attempted to turn the blade by hand. One would almost move, the other was seized. No amount of effort or tools would get it working again. Pretty expensive disposal if it only lasts 4 years with extremely light usage.
customer_reviews.author: Covergirl

customer_reviews.title: Overall Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great on this unit other than one small item. Installation took a little longer than we expected due to the anti-vibration rubber connection on the side of the unit. The PVC drain kept popping out of the anti-vibration connection. It seems like if you had your garbage next to the drain and bumped it hard enough it could pop loose. Also, when popping out the plastic barrier for the dishwasher the plastic reminisce will fall into the disposal itself. We did not know that so when we started the unit up for the first time the plastic caused some weird grinding noises. After removing the plastic pieces with needle nose pliers it operated perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Bull

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I'm a licensed plumber, and this is the model I always install. I consider it to be the industry standard. The 1 horse power is so much more expensive than the 3/4 horse power, that I wouldn't consider it, unless a customer really insisted. Being familiar with them both, I always suggest the 3/4 horsepower.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install in just 30 minutes
customer_reviews.text: We first made sure that we were fully prepared before starting on the project. We had all the tools and plumbers putty ready to go. We could have used the old mount from our previous disposal cause it was exactly the same size, but decided to go all new and it was super easy to do. The instructions were easy to understand and covered every step. We hardwired this like our other one and also found that to be really simple. From start to finish it just took us 30 minutes. It's much quieter than our old one and a lot more powerful. We are pleased with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Easy install. Quiet, but not silent.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with item. Very easy to replace our old badger 5 with this. Did not need to remove the flange that’s why I stuck with this brand. It takes up marginally more room under the cabinet. I did have to cut down one length of pvc pipe that the new disposal came with so be sure you have a hacksaw or jigsaw handy. Honestly getting the cord switched over took the most time. Took about 20 minutes total for a regular guy that is moderately handy but little plumbing experience. It’s not as quiet as some reviews would lead me to believe, but noticeably more quiet than the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome disposer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace an older, leaky 1/2hp Badger 5. The Evolution Compact is surprisingly quiet and a solid disposer. Installation is easy as you would expect from their mounting system but the dimensions are slightly different from the Badger. The dimensional differences may or may not be an issue for you, I don’t know how your sink is plumbed but mated perfectly to my system. I would recommend using the included flange. It will fit the standard insinkerator flange but is worth the effort to install the new one. This thing is ridiculously quiet, has plenty of power, and an extremely long in-house warranty. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Unit
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 20yr old disposer with this little beauty. There were cheeper ones, but reviews swayed me and have been most pleased with my purchase. Much quieter than the old unit and mounted up quick easy. Don't think twice smash the buy it now! PRO-TIP make sure you have new hose clamps on hand reusing old ones may not be an option.
customer_reviews.author: DR II

customer_reviews.title: Easy replacement for the Insinkerator Badger 1 model.
customer_reviews.text: Easy replacement for the Insinkerator Badger 1 model. No plumbing modifications were needed under my sink to complete the replacement, even though the Evolution Compact 3/4 HP is about 1 inch larger diameter overall. The connection points to the sink drain and plumbing are the same, so a direct swap is possible. The advantages of the Evolution Compact 3/4 HP vs the Badger 1 are worth the extra cost: 3/4 HP vs 1/3 HP Multi stage grinder vs single stage grinder Nearly silent vs noisy.
customer_reviews.author: nozama

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 years and 9 months :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this garbage disposal back in early 2018. I got the impression it would be a good long term solution for my kitchen. I live alone and make a serious attempt to not put food down the drain very often. I worked for a plumber in HS and saw a lot of drain systems messed up from people putting too much food in the disposal instead of throwing it in the garbage. Any way rare light usage for 2.5 years and it died on me. It spins freely with a wooden spoon and the reset button is not the issue. Waste of $200
customer_reviews.author: BarryB

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to install as you would think.
customer_reviews.text: The InSinkErator was hard to get on the ring that holds it up, for some reason. But the other hook-ups like the wiring and plumbing were exactly the same as our old unit, so that was great! The others reviews are spot on, that it is very quiet, especially more that the old 13 year old unit we replaced. I got the space saver and it did give me some more room under the sink, where my wife stores all her do-dads and soaps. I really like the unit so far and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry F

customer_reviews.title: Beware when replacing a disposal in a confined space
customer_reviews.text: Finally got the product installed. The disposal works well and is very quiet. Solid piece of engineering. The instruction were OK but could have been better. I found it necessary to have something to support it when installing, I used a car scissor jack. My difficulty came from installation in a tight spot. There is little space between the unit and the back wall in my under-sink cupboard. It was tight for the previous "Badger" model, REALLY tight with the extra girth on this model. Made it eventually but it cost me over $5 in the swear-jar.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Farr

customer_reviews.title: A very quiet high quality disposal
customer_reviews.text: This InSinkErator Evolution Compact is a high-quality product. When you turn it on all you hear is the water running and spinning around in the disposal. It is truly the best garbage disposal that I've ever owned. It is a big improvement over my old InSinkErator Badger 900 that only lasted a year past the 3 year warranty. This unit has an eight year warranty. The plumber hooked it up easily to the hardwired electric line and the hose in from the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and very quiet!
customer_reviews.text: What a nice garbage-disposer! Simple and easy to understand installation instructions. And so quiet! It took an hour to replace the former Badger 5 Insinkerator. Very easy job! This Insinkerator Evolution Compact came with a baffle that many reviewers had issues with as it installs from the top, which they say, restricts water flow . So instead, I used the standard baffle that installs underneath between the unit and coupling. I took it off the former unit as it was in like new condition and fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna2010

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is very quiet, but food doesn't fall in easily.
customer_reviews.text: We had the guy doing our kitchen upgrade install it so I don't hard it is. My wife said it took some effort for him so take that for what it is. I have installed others and they all are a PITA. Works great and is very quiet. I give it a 4 b/c the rubber in the drain opening is designed poorly as food does not fall into the disposal but pools at he opening and you have to force it into the disposal. Weird to have a great (and expensive) unit with a stupid kink like that.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Seamans

customer_reviews.title: Changed out while in my office clothes
customer_reviews.text: Replaced old Kenmore(insinkerator) after 15 years of service with little muss or fuss. Didn't take much to wrench open the pipes, swap the power cord and rehang the disposal. It would be helpful if there was a thing or tip in regards to supporting the disposal's weight while getting all three lugs on the collar to engage. If you do this all the time it's no big deal, but once every decade and a half it sort of throws you. Next time I'll watch a youtube before diving in. Very surprised by sound level. Ours is a cast iron sink and between that and this disposal I now can take a call without having to turn this off.
customer_reviews.author: S C.

customer_reviews.title: does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: I love this garbage disposal! They last about 5 years or more, but are worth the cost. Our sink has a cabinet with a upright in the center of the two doors, that makes it hard to install. They weight is hard to hold with one hand, and trying to get it in took about an hour. Besides that, I and my husband love this model and will always purchase this product when needed. Very quiet, and does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a replacement for an 8 year old InSinkErator model that was just getting to the point where even disposing of water was an issue! This one is far better than my previous disposal, even in its prime it struggled with anything remotely tough, but this one is fast and quiet and totally empty after each use. Super easy to install thanks to the InSinkErator collar and no leaks at all. I thought about getting a more expensive model but I'm really pleased with this one and I can't imagine that the more expensive models would do much better unless you're using it in a professional kitchen. For regular household use, this is definitely adequate.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Sold me a previously purchased unit!
customer_reviews.text: The Insinkerator Evolution compact disposal I purchased was not new, it had been previously purchased. The installation kit came in a plastic bag that had already been opened (clearly torn open) and the drain plug in the dishwasher connection had been removed! I do not need the dishwasher connection and I only discovered the drain plug missing after operating the unit with tap water running and finding water all over the floor of the sink cabinet! Initially I thought the connection to the sink drain was leaking until I discovered the drain plug was missing. I guess I expected better since this unit was sold by Amazon and not a third party.
customer_reviews.author: OellaMama

customer_reviews.title: Easily replaced 2010 5/8 HP SPACE SAVER-P-1
customer_reviews.text: Our old InSinkErator was no longer completely disposing food waste. The p/n 71022 shredding plate was probably worn, leaving too much gap between lugs and grind ring. While that rotating shredder AKA shredder blade is available separately for considerably less than the cost of a new InSinkErator, replacement instructions were not found. Fortunately, this 3/4 HP Evolution Compact uses the same power cord, sink flange and tailpipe mount, allowing for essentially plug-and-play replacement. No leaks, less noise, all good.
customer_reviews.author: blekenbleu

customer_reviews.title: Not the same size as older Evolution Compact
customer_reviews.text: This unit is wider than the old unit I'm replacing. It now wont line up with hole in sink due to existing plumbing. Why make a model designed to fit tight spaces and then change it to be wider? Anyways, have to return it now because the "easy installation " garbage disposal requires me to take out all my existing plumbing and re do it to fit around this unit which is the same model as my old one.... what an unbelievably stupid thing to do
customer_reviews.author: BagOfDicks

customer_reviews.title: Works great but leaks
customer_reviews.text: It will chew up anything you put in it but the seal between the disposal and the sink drain doesn't fit properly. After putting it in 8 (no joke) times I gave up and it just leaks. I'll get back to it soon and just plumber putty the living h3ll out of it but that gasket doesn't fit properly at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a well made and effective unit. My plumber installed it, and he said it was a breeze to install. It was a replacement unit for my old Insinkerator that lasted maybe 5-6 years? This can be noisy, as they all can be, but really the most important thing is, is it munches up the food waste really well and drains well too. With the exception of a freeze over winter which caused a waste blockage in my sink that my plumber had to clear (not the units fault), this has been a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kinimaka

customer_reviews.title: Not too loud; ZERO PROBLEMS so far
customer_reviews.text: Build quality appears to be very good. Installation steps are not difficult, but you may need a second person to help you hold things while you install. It is fairly quiet. Not quiet, but not that loud either, and much quieter than the old one it replaced. We don't throw anything and everything down the disposal (it's a bad idea, regardless), but for the smaller and softer pieces that do go down, we've had no issues whatsoever with this thing so far, in a year of use. If that ever changes, I'll try to remember to update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So glad I picked this one...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced broken disposal with this model. BTW, not obvious in description but seems they all have optional dishwasher attachment. Wasted time looking for ones specifically "with dishwasher" connection. No need, they all have it. At least this model. REALLY thought long and hard about picking the cheaper version. SOOO glad I didn't. This one is so much better and the noise level is so low sometimes I can't even tell it's on. Oh, and way easy to install, even easier when staying with Insinkerator brand. Spend the extra $ and buy this one. Very happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: ChadH

customer_reviews.title: Buy this over a normal badger
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a non turning Badger 1 that was 10+ years old probably. I am absolutely amazed at how quiet this thing is. If the old one was a 10 this is a 3. I also installed it with no prior knowledge of how to in 40 minutes, and I replaced the throat because the old one was worn and not centered. Super easy. Also, all the ports are in the same spot as the badger line, so it’s almost plug and play (I had to shorten the new drain by about an inch.) Well worth the extra 50 bucks or so over a normal badger for the longer warranty, sound reduction, and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Barely makes any noise
customer_reviews.text: This disposing unit is "the Cadillac of disposing units", that's what my plumber said to me. It's VERY quiet. It has stainless steel inside so it'll never rust. If you drop a metal object in it and turn it on, since it's made of stainless steel, it will not take any rust protecting coating and rust. Nope, not going to happen with this unit. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ryk

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement disposal
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this disposal to replace one from Sears that was leaking. I originally tried to find another one like my previous model but it is no longer sold - which turned out to be good for me. This new disposal works great, is quiet and was much easier to install that the last one. The rubber flex on for the disposal inlet makes for an easier installation and I did not have to replace any of the existing plumbing. The directions were very easy to understand as well. I would buy this again but hopefully it will last much longer than my previous tow Sears Kenmore ones!
customer_reviews.author: armadillo

customer_reviews.title: Nice disposal, but........
customer_reviews.text: Most importantly this is a very quiet disposal. My low rating is due to the fact that the Mounting Ring was faulty and could not mesh with the other parts connecting to the sink itself. Fortunately for me, it was being installed by a licensed plumber and he had a replacement part on his truck and could finish the job. Had I been installing the disposal myself it never could have been completed.
customer_reviews.author: ballroom

customer_reviews.title: The ultimate nullifier
customer_reviews.text: I mean, where do I begin... For years I thought to myself, what if the food going down the drain was macerated better. I never thought there was any other option. Oh what a fool I was. This little baby chomps it right down to the very atoms. You’ve heard of conservation of energy? Not when it comes to this food disposal. Have any enemies you’d like to make disappear? Well here’s your answer. A true Must buy for all 7 billion people on this earth.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Palmiter

customer_reviews.title: Time Will Tell ...
customer_reviews.text: I'll note on my calendar July of 2030 to update - right. By then I'll be satisfied if still operating. The noise level is quieter than my 32 year old that I replaced, but it could be quieter. If I press lightly on different locations on the outer cover it's considerably quieter. The noise is not from the mechanics but rather vibration. Instructions were good when you could find the English.
customer_reviews.author: PIRATE19

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace a Badger that started leaking badly. I wanted to replace the disposal myself, and it turned it to be pretty easy. The instructions were very clear and step by step, so even though I've never done this before, it wasn't too complicated. It does NOT come with the power cord kit, which you'll need, so be sure to buy it as well. It is quite heavy (heavy enough that I couldn't lift it and holds it up long enough to install) so I used a car jack to hold it up while I connected it. Problem solved! It runs more quietly than our previous disposal and seems to be more efficient. We're happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie L.

customer_reviews.title: Great disposal well designed and dependable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a very similar disposal, same brand and specifications. When our technician took examined the original disposal he told us that not only was there nothing wrong with it but that the new one was the same model!!! You can believe that I was embarrassed and happy at the same time.i returned the new disposal but will not hesitate to buy it again as we have had excellent service from this model for years.
customer_reviews.author: M. Snider

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I had and InSinkErator in my wide body houseboat when I purchased it, to grind up the debris from washing dishes; prior to it getting pumped out into the lake for the fishies to consume. This one is even better. The bottom grinding chamber is large and very easy to clean. And talk about power! It sucks the water down my giant-one-bay sink quickly. I love it and would buy another. It also has removable rubber flanges so you can easily clean the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Diane H Holycross

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an insinkerator unit that had served us for 23 years. It still worked, but sounded like a rock crusher. This unit is so quiet that you hardly know it’s running. It seems to eat anything with ease but we haven’t really pushed it. Let’s just say that it eats leftover pizza in one big gulp without a hiccup. We love it. Great evaluation of a great product.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. K.

customer_reviews.title: Quality & Quitness
customer_reviews.text: This disposal is one of the best on the market, this is a replacement of the same one we had which lasted for 19 years... One word of thought; the two parts inside the unit that do the shredding are made of a hard metal, most hard metals can be Brittle to a certain extent, I would not put anything that is hard such as ice cubes, bones or any similar items in the disposal, it could lead to the possible cracking of the two shredders.....otherwise this is a quite & good unit.............
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: As loud as the cheaper Badger models
customer_reviews.text: This is for the Evolution Compact 2 model I just installed. It's as loud as the cheaper Badger models. I had an Evolution Compact 1 model disposal that had been working great since 2011, but it finally quit working right. I tried to find another Compact 1, but I guess they "Improved" (meaning the price was more now) the model and had to change the name to Compact 2. The old one was literally whisper quit. The new one growls just like the cheap badger disposals I used to install when I was doing rental property handyman work. Really disappointed. I would suggest getting another brand.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for 444
customer_reviews.text: Snap out, snap in. Fits standard ISE collar, slightly larger, maybe 3" on diameter, same height. 20 minute job unless you need to rejigger the drain because of the bigger diameter. Then maybe 30. Notably quieter. Same price as big box stores, better shipping. The 444 lasted 16 years in daily use, finally died of a grind chamber leak. No complaints there, either. Way past warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a shade over 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Installs fine but started to jam up after 2 years. Had to use the Allen wrench tool provided several time to get it going again but now that does not work anymore. We treat our disposal like a baby too, most hard stuff gets thrown away or into our planters. Just not durable. *Update: Called Insinkerator and they had gave me an Appliance Company to call for an Warranty replacement. So now I have a brand new disposal, hopefully it will last longer this time.
customer_reviews.author: James A Summers

customer_reviews.title: Why does it have a bad chemical smell?
customer_reviews.text: Mechanically, it is fantastic. Quiet, grind all the tough things that my previous Badger unit couldn't do well. Yet, my biggest and most disappointment is the smell. Ever since I install and start using it. the undersink cabinet has a strange and unpleasant chemical smell. Too bad. It was such a big hassle to install and hence, I don't want to take it out. But I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: henry d-sl

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Do your homework before installation.
customer_reviews.text: This was the first garbage disposal I ever installed. To minimize the installation time, I watched several videos on installation instructions. About the electrical equipment ahead of time and install that, which was helpful. Installation was fairly straightforward. No leaks were noted with the plumbers putty. The machine runs very quietly, In fact my wife thought it wasn’t working because it was so quiet. Overall, high-quality product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pendley

customer_reviews.title: Great disposal, but with a caution
customer_reviews.text: The disposal is great - it's powerful and it's quiet. My only issue is that I installed it on a farmhouse sink, which is thicker, apparently, than a "standard" sink. That meant that I had to order a separate extended collar which cost $51 DOLLARS! A standard collars costs about $10 in a hardware store, but these guys seem to have a monopoly on the extended collar (which should cost, maybe $15). Just a point of caution.
customer_reviews.author: John 9999

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: replaced an older model in-sink-erator that was leaking (many years old) and it had theez install cuff so I was able to unplug anf pop the old one off and pop the new one one the same collar and reconnect the plug and drain line very easily. its quiet and has a small form factor / footprint for those with less space under their sinks, very robust little unit.
customer_reviews.author: M. Green

customer_reviews.title: Very good, much better than our old cheap badger 5
customer_reviews.text: Extremely quiet, wasn’t hard to install but there were a few tricky parts. My only complaint is the rubber piece that goes in the drain (not the cap) does not let water drain well at all so if your running the dishwasher you have to hold the rubber open so water can get down to the dishwasher
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and durable disposal machine
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this model for 7 years and have been happy with it so this is our 2nd purchase for another replacement of the old Insinkerator Badge5 that developed rust and leakage on the bottom. This model is fairly quiet, made of stainless steel so it is slightly heavier and larger than the old Badge5 model. Just remember that it does not come with it's own power cord so use the one from the old disposal or have a new cord on hand. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Great product and experience.
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived as advertised- time and description. The instructions were clear. Just be sure to read them before beginning. It is hard wired not plug in. There are also a couple of other items needed-plumber’s putty, wire nuts; read the details in the instructions. You may need an assistant to help position it for final installation. It is quiet. The kit contains the required piping for connecting to drainage.
customer_reviews.author: notmyrealname

customer_reviews.title: Great disposal. VERY QUIET.
customer_reviews.text: Disposal was exactly as advertised, but much quieter than expected, even after reading reviews. Was actually concerned it was not working when first turned on, because it was so quiet. Major upgrade from the noisy one we had. Handles all food wastes easily. Rubber catch pops in and out with ease, when you have large amount of food waste. Easy to install, no problems. Recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: cleverjester

customer_reviews.title: Revised review
customer_reviews.text: Revised review! After expressing my disappointment I was contacted by jerica from insink areator. She walked me thru and the first thing she suggested solved my noise issue! I'm very happy and impressed. I would recommend highly!!! This thing can wake the dead. Would not recommend. Wish I had gone with the wasteking and saved money but I had an insink areator before and thought I would stick with what I know. My parents have this same one they bought locally and you can't even hear theirs. Guess I got a defective unit from amazon but it cost me $100 to have it installed so I'm stuck. What a waste!
customer_reviews.author: A. Gift For You

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Typical install - you will need plumbers putty (like $4 at home depot). No leaks and was much quieter than an old badger 5. Advice: Don't be like me and lay on your back trying to install the electrical. Buy a plug or wire to make an extension. I don't have an outlet, only a hardwire from a hole in the cabinet and it's too short to pre-wire before mounting. In the future, I'd say add an extension or build your own cable. Will update to 5 stars after I test the grinding abilities.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Replaced our Badger 5 perfectly
customer_reviews.text: At first I was concerned because the pictures only show the unit with a 90 degree elbow going down. But, it came with a straight pipe that was exactly what I used to install the Badger 10-12 years ago. All I had to do was cut down that pipe 1 3/4" to fit perfectly. Less than an hour install. Very quiet compared to the Badger!
customer_reviews.author: Becky & Pat  WA, state

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install into a new sink, nice an quiet, only one problem
customer_reviews.text: And that problem is the new style rubber collar that is used. Has too many flaps (used to help make it quiet) but that rubber collar keeps dropping down into the disposer. Very poor design to keep it in place. But the disposer is quieter and appears to d a lot better job of grinding food than the badger series it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Quality disposal
customer_reviews.text: Simple mount. Just make sure to spin it on until it locks. You might need pliers. If it falls off, you did it wrong. Very quiet and powerful. Simple installation. Have used many of these without any problems. Compact version gives more room in the sink cabinet. Only thing I don’t like is the plastic drain stop. Not as nice as the old metal ones but I don’t really use it much.
customer_reviews.author: Youser

customer_reviews.title: Can You Hear Me Now?
customer_reviews.text: NO! This disposal is a dream. We had lived so long with our twenty-plus year old Waste King that we though all units were loud enough to drown out the television at top volume. NOT SO! This Insinkerator model is the quietist machine of its kind that anyone we know is aware of. Until we got used to, for days we though it wasn't working because it is so quiet. AND it does what it is supposed to do to kitchen waste with equal excellence.
customer_reviews.author: Design Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous! Quiet and effective.
customer_reviews.text: I had this professionally installed, so I can't speak to the installation ease--but I can say that the plumber went out of his way to praise the purchase: "These are the BEST! Great choice." he said. The unit is unbelievably quiet, so much so that I actually forgot to turn it off for a few minutes once (before finally noticing an odd hum. Lol). Seems to do a great job of grinding. I'm vegetarian, so I can't tell you how well it deals with gristle and stuff like that, but for my purposes, this disposal is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Infidel

customer_reviews.title: Love this disposal
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 10 year old Badger 5 that died. I am a first timer and thought the installation was very straightforward. I replaced the entire drain and mounting bracket because I wanted to have the newer in sink baffle and the way my old one was installed I could not get it out without replacing everything. Nevertheless, the whole thing took less than 1 hour. It is super quiet and is a nice upgrade from the Badger 5. Insinkerator is a great company and they make a great product, so I am looking forward to many years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Fagan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and this disposer is SO MUCH QUIETER ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and this disposer is SO MUCH QUIETER than the Badger! We replaced the 1/2 HP Badger with this 3/4 HP Evolution because the badger began to leak out the bottom. I love the way it works so quickly and when I take the sink muffler/gasket out, I can see into the disposer that all the food particles are gone, so no more smelly kitchen! There is more room underneath the sink even though the body of the disposer is a bit larger. It is a great design! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: I redid my kitchen and had a plumber install this so I cannot talk too much about the installation process but I've had no issues with it so far and it is extremely quiet. I am used to a loud garbage disposer so when I first turn this on I sometimes don't think it's actually on - but it is. I've very impressed with the quality so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Shhhhhhhh Quiet!
customer_reviews.text: This disposal is very quiet. It is absolutely wonderful. It fit well under the counter and the rubber where the food goes into is removable should it need replacing and for cleaning. It has an 8 year warranty and it is pretty. I have only had it for a very short period of time but thus far. It is exactly what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love this disposal. It is very quiet and gets the job done. I wouldn't say it was easy to install because working upsidedown under the sink is never easy. But that's not the unit's fault. The unit itself went in easy enough. The directions, for the most part, were understandable even to a novice, and it fit under my sink without taking up much space. This unit was not rated the quietest, but it sure IS quiet! I'm not a heavy user of the product (don't cook a lot), but, so far, I'm glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Ardell

customer_reviews.title: Glad we chose this one!
customer_reviews.text: This disposal is so quiet and runs well. Our plumber had no problems installing it (personal reasons for having plumber). The only situation so far is on one time of usage we heard a faint metallic clicking sound. Couldn't find anything preventing it from working. Reread instructions and tried grinding whole ice cubes which solved the problem!
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Nancy

customer_reviews.title: I bought a Waste King off a Gold Box deal at first
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't consider myself handy by any means but I was able to remove my old Badger 5 and install the Evolution Compact in 10 minutes! I bought a Waste King off a Gold Box deal at first, and would avoid it like the plague. The Waste King is difficult to install, and much taller than most models so it may require you to repipe you're entire drainage system. 10/10 would recommend the Evolution Compact. Remember to buy a power cable as removing the old one out of a Badger 5 is near impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: So quiet and does a great job!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new garage disposal. Best disposal I have ever had and I’ve had six throughout my lifetime. It is so quiet and it has taken on even some of the tougher veggie remains. Celery, Beans, egg shells, mini pepper tops. I had bought the cord kit to install with this disposal and it installed beautifully. Very heavy install did require two of us to get it mounted to sink bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Tom L. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I've ever had a garbage disposal that is this quiet! Seems to work well. NOTICE for do-it-yourself installers: be sure to take off the small plastic cap that prevents water from flowing into the dishwasher and filling up! It took 2 minutes and $85 for a plumber removed it..
customer_reviews.author: nolilite

customer_reviews.title: Consumer Reports rated well
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of reviews and saw that Consumer Reports rated this one very well. This was purchased as part of a kitchen remodel that starts in two weeks and I didn't want the plumber/electrician to install whatever they had on their shelves. It looks like it will work when it is installed in three months.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect noise level and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an existing model of the same brand. I used the power cable and sink fixture from the old one. Whole thing was in in under twenty minutes from opening box to grinding food. Loud enough to know it’s running without disrupting conversation. Perfect noise level. It’s also short enough I can now store a basket of cleaning supplies under it!
customer_reviews.author: carlson

customer_reviews.title: Quieter than our previous model
customer_reviews.text: Price was decent. Installed this myself in a Blanco Precis Super Single Bowl kitchen sink. It has gotten a little more noisy over time but overall much quieter than our previous, lower end InSinkErator. Performs well with bulkier vegetable peels. The rubber gasket where the water runs in from the sink is sealed a bit too well, this is likely by design to help reduce the noise. The only issue is that larger peels and pieces of food can build up at the gasket if they don't go through and you end up using a utensil or fingers to nudge the food threw the rubber gasket. Purchased the InSinkErator CRD-00 power code with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: jjats

customer_reviews.title: Decent Disposal, Not Too Loud
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this disposal for a year now with no complaints. It chews through everything we have thrown at it and is actually pretty quiet compared to the older models. Installation was straight forward as we just replaced an older Insinkerator model with the same hardware. Would recommend for a small-family sized disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Keep Shopping!
customer_reviews.text: It's not that quiet. All fibrous foods (banana skins, onion stems) and all fats stay in the chamber.......I have to remove them manually. It is imperative to sharpen blades with ice cubes at least once a week. The only good thing is the removable rubber - it's easy to keep clean. Other than that, this is an overpriced, underperforming and very disappointing incinerator.
customer_reviews.author: tatmalik

customer_reviews.title: Love my new disposal
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews and decided this 3/4hp model was the one for me. Arrived quickly, all packaging intact. After a cursory glance at the destructions, I tackled the project. I hafta admit, I'm pretty handy and do most of the home improvement projects around my house, so this installation really didn't seem like a big deal. It is HEAVY, so I needed my husband to help me hold it up while I attached, other than that it was an easy-peasy install. Turned it on and yippee, quiet and powerful. It's been a couple weeks now, and I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Compact disposer, quiet and very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Compact unit with plenty of power. Comes with everything you need except some plumber's putty. Very quiet as others have observed. The comments regarding this unit not allowing the sink to drain properly probably has something to do with the fact that they must have the "Quiet Collar" installed upside down! Simply lift it out and turn it over...magic....the sink drains properly! The (admittedly small) picture in the parts list shows it installed the way it should be.
customer_reviews.author: HH Steve

customer_reviews.title: Comes without a power cord
customer_reviews.text: So far, brief ownership, self-installed, it’s very nice. I replaced an earlier model of the same brand, and that helped with the installation; I did not have to install a new drain bracket. However, I kept the old drain stopper because it is stainless steel whereas the new model comes with a plastic stopper. Sad that it does not come with a three dollar power cord. Be sure to order one if you do not have one available from the unit you are replacing.
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: Definite upgrade from the Badger 5
customer_reviews.text: We've been perfectly happy with the Badger 5 for many years. It can time to replace the unit and we jumped for this instead because of the increase HP (3/4 HP on this vs. 1/2 HP on the Badger 5) and the noise level. Installation on the Evolution Compact was easier and more forgiving, thanks to the upgraded design. The Evolution Compact is significantly quieter, too. We're very happy with the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: B. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Adequate but not your grandfathers unit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace an older generation unit that had a missing flail. The earlier generation, though handicapped, actually grinded everything faster and finer. I find the parallel to be amusing. No doubt this change is an effort to quiet the unit so as not to offend sensitive ears. Anyways. In utter honesty the machine works rather well it just takes a litte longer—-mainly on the stringy items such as banana peels. I usually just leave it as is, knowing it will eventually process. I do find a little grit like a chicken bone or olive pit aids the process along in such instances.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Finn

customer_reviews.title: FIVE YEARS LATER AND STILL GOING STRONG!!
customer_reviews.text: Hey all~! So we built our house (electrical wiring throughout/ cabinetry/ sheetrock/ painting--we did most of the work ourselves) and I was a little skeptical to buy this product because it was "cheaper" than what our plumber recommended. Well here we are three years later after installing it and I have ZERO regrets about buying it. It's awesome and its pretty dang quiet. I still love it to this day. **Edited 2/19/19 :: This has been an amazing purchase for us you guys. 5 years later and absolutely zero issues. It’s still super quiet (just as quiet as the first day of use). I’m so happy with this purchase and the power it yields. It rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent professional garbage disposal
customer_reviews.text: Great garbage disposal. It disposes of pretty much everything you throw at it (even bones). Very quiet and a huge upgrade from a consumer level one. Only downside is that it's super heavy! Which means, during install, it is a bit harder than the lighter weight consumer ones. Once you get past install though, you'll be happy you bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: One of my big mistakes....
customer_reviews.text: Since I have a small household, I felt that a 3/4 HP motor would be sufficient, but I made a big mistake. Over 50 years and multiple kitchens, I've used many InSinkErators and until now I've been happy with the product. Not now. This unit takes much longer to dispose of food and leaves particles - like lemon, melon rinds - no matter how long I run the disposer. I gave it two stars because I try not to use the word "hate" with the world so hostile, but it's a single or zero star product.
customer_reviews.author: Dolly Domestic

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about two years. It is unbelievably quiet and has never rejected anything I've given to it. Contra: The rubber sink baffle (barrier you have to push the food through) requires actual manual pushing to get a lot of food down. It doesn't have slots in the rubber so food can't easily slip through, but instead has folds that capture bits of foodstuffs. I often find myself having to grab a used utensil to shove excess waste down into the disposal.
customer_reviews.author: lachrymal

customer_reviews.title: It's so powerful and quiet!
customer_reviews.text: Our old InSinkErator 1/2 HP sounded like it was going to jump out from under our sink every time we ran it. This new one is so quiet we wonder if it's doing anything! It works like a nearly silent champ, although we also don't abuse it by putting carrot/potato peel or hard cores in it.
customer_reviews.author: eco-mom

customer_reviews.title: Extremely quiet compared to Badger 1!!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced the Badger 1 that came with our house. The original unit was 13 years old and started leaking from inside. The difference in volume is ridiculous!! The Evo Compact is so much quieter I still surprise myself when I use it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: gspfunk

customer_reviews.title: more expensive than other brands but happy with it
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this, Costco had American standard on sale for $79, so it took some debating and research to choose as this one cost more than twice as much as the costco sale price. After reading all the reviews and the 5-year come-to-your home service warranty got me decide to fork out the extra and go with this one. So far very happy with how quiet and effective this unit is!
customer_reviews.author: Likeitblue

customer_reviews.title: Garbage product that may destroy your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This garbage disposal started leaking from the drain port less than 2 months after we had it installed ruining our brand new cabinets. After contacting insink erator, they send out someone to repair it and they ended up putting a brand new one in. This was nice but did nothing to resolve the damage caused to the cabinets it leaked into.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Welton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and quiet upgrade to the kitchen sink. Just be aware that this is a few inches bigger around than your industry standard cheapie 'Badger' model that comes under many sinks. If you've got a plumber installing it you're good to go, they'll have everything you need. If it's you, plan on making a trip to the pvc aisle to do a bit of plumbing tetris once you' pull the old one out and discover that the waste line doesn't line up.
customer_reviews.author: timsonic

customer_reviews.title: So very slow to drain, needs to be modified!
customer_reviews.text: Slow draining and doesn't create any suction when turned on. For the price I thought I was getting a top of the line garbage disposal but I would rank it as average at best. This install was pretty straight forward and easy for its high point. But I can't get over the standing water in the sink every time I turn on the faucet. Overall I do not recommend this disposal
customer_reviews.author: B. Chaney

customer_reviews.title: Really quiet and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Our household likes how quiet this disposer is. My husband liked how easy it was to install. And I like how the rubber gasket lifts out, so you can clean it and clean underneath it. It's hard to get excited about a garbage disposer, but this one is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great Garbage Disposal
customer_reviews.text: It is unfortunate that these machines don't have a longer life span - replaced a 12 year old very rusty same mfg unit with this one. It is so quite that i needed to check that in fact it was working. It was. And was easy to install too. So far - great. I guess for 10 years or so....
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My only con on this purchase was that I did not realize the electrical cords do not come with product. Plumber installed then informed us that either the electrician or we ourselves could install the electrical cords. This really should be done before installing. Apparently many appliances require the owner to order or buy the electrical cords. Expensive GE dishwasher same deal. We were able to purchase through Home Depot for 11.99 a piece and then my husband is very handy and he was able to attach the electrical cords himself. Other than that little hiccup we are ver satisfied with the product overall and were able to purchase for half of what we would have bought in town.
customer_reviews.author: Jg

customer_reviews.title: Grinds chicken bones with ease (when my wife is out of "range")
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install and it operates very quietly. Also it takes up very little space under the sink. The old one (different brand) would cause the drain pipe to clog when grinding vegetable waste. This one grinds everything with ease. The box clearly indicate that you can grind chicken bones. Although my wife keeps insisting it can not and it will damage the unit. CONFIDENTIAL I can report that it does a fine job on the chicken bones when my wife is out of range :) ... obviously it does make some noise when grinding bones.
customer_reviews.author: Internet shopper

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I had a disposal that started leaking so needed to replace. After looking at several different ones I decided to purchase this one. It was super easy to swap out and functioned properly. I purchased hoping that this would be quieter than the older one. I wasn't disappointed. It's really quiet and more powerful than what I had before. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: todd

product_meta.title: InSinkErator Evolution Compact 3/4 HP Compact Garbage Disposer
product_meta.description: Clean your sink, and keep your drains free of build-up with InSinkErator's Evolution Compact 3/4HP Household Garbage Disposal. If you're grossed out by drain stoppers filled with the squished and soggy remains of breakfast cereal, this garbage disposal is going to be your new best friend. You'll also be doing your part in helping the environment, by cutting down on plastic bag usage and reducing the amount of waste in landfills. With a 3/4 horsepower motor, this disposal can easily chop and eliminate any mess your kitchen can come up with, without shredding your paycheck. Make dishwashing less icky, and keep your kitchen spotless with an InSinkErator Compact Kitchen Garbage Disposal.
feature_bullets: SPACE EFFICIENT, DURABLE COMPONENTS: Perfect for small households or houses with restricted cabinet space, this garbage disposal easily fits under your sink & features alloy stainless steel components with a LeakGuard Liner for the highest durability.

QUIET BUT POWERFUL: This innovative food waste disposal features noise reducing SoundSeal Technology, our exclusive, long lasting 3/4 hp Dura-Drive Induction Motor, and 2-Stage Multigrind Technology to handle the toughest food scraps.

AMERICA'S #1 DISPOSER BRAND: There are more American-built InSinkErator garbage disposals in US homes than all other brands combined. A full line of models means there's one right for every need and budget. Grind Chamber Capacity - 34.6 ounces. Drain Connection - 1-1/2 inch Anti-Vibration (Hose Clamp). Average Electrical Usage - 3-4 KWh Per Year
FASTER, CLEANER, SMARTER: From meal prep to cleanup, InSinkErator helps make it fast & easy to keep your kitchen clean with our iconic appliances: garbage disposals & instant hot water dispensers.

A HISTORY OF INNOVATION FOR THE SINK: We invented garbage disposals in 1927, & we're the world’s largest manufacturer of garbage disposals & instant hot water dispensers for home & commercial use.Lubrication:Permanently Lubricated Upper & Lower Bearings

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars4,110 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
